paragraphs.title: Zepl Demo Notebook 1
paragraphs.text:
%md
__THIS NOTEBOOK ONLY WORKS ON ZELP PLATFORM__
Demonstrate loading, querying, visualizing, and saving a small ~21k row kaggle dataset.
The 'Transactions from a bakery' dataset available to download on [kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/sulmansarwar/transactions-from-a-bakery/data#).

msg.data:
THIS NOTEBOOK ONLY WORKS ON ZELP PLATFORM
Demonstrate loading, querying, visualizing, and saving a small ~21k row kaggle dataset.
The ‘Transactions from a bakery’ dataset available to download on kaggle.

paragraphs.title: Import Python Packages
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
from pyspark import SparkFiles
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, IntegerType

paragraphs.title: Load CSV Data into DataFrame
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
# load csv format data file into Spark DataFrame
bakery_schema = StructType([
    StructField('date', StringType(), True),
    StructField('time', StringType(), True),
    StructField('transaction', IntegerType(), True),
    StructField('item', StringType(), True)
])

df_bakery1 = spark.read \
    .format("csv") \
    .option("header", "true") \
    .load("BreadBasket_DMS.csv", schema=bakery_schema)

df_bakery1.show(10, False)
df_bakery1.count()

paragraphs.title: Write, Read, Load Parquet Data
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
# write, read, load parquet format data files into Spark DataFrame
df_bakery1.write.parquet('data/bakery_parquet_zepl', mode='overwrite')
df_bakery2 = spark.read.parquet('data/bakery_parquet_zepl')

df_bakery2.show(5, False)
df_bakery2.count()

paragraphs.title: Create Temporary View of Data
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
# create a temporary view of a Spark DataFrame and run a sql query against it
df_bakery2.createOrReplaceTempView("bakery_table_tmp")

df_bakery3 = spark.sql("SELECT transaction, date, item " +
                       "FROM bakery_table_tmp " +
                       "WHERE item NOT LIKE 'NONE'" +
                       "ORDER BY transaction")

type(df_bakery3)
df_bakery3.show(5)
df_bakery3.count()

paragraphs.title: Replace Temporary View
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
# replace a temporary view of a Spark DataFrame and run a sql query against it
df_bakery3.createOrReplaceTempView("bakery")

df_bakery4 = spark.sql("SELECT date, count(*) as item_count " +
                       "FROM bakery " +
                       "WHERE date >= '2017-01-01' " +
                       "GROUP BY date " +
                       "ORDER BY date")

df_bakery4.show(5)
df_bakery4.count()

paragraphs.title: Native ZELP Visualization Based on SQL Query
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT date, count(*) as items
FROM bakery
WHERE date BETWEEN '2017-01-01' AND '2017-03-31'
GROUP BY date
ORDER BY date

paragraphs.title: Native ZELP Visualization Based on SQL Query
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT count(*) as items, item
FROM bakery
GROUP BY item
ORDER BY items
DESC LIMIT 10
